title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic hints at incredible return to La Liga
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has sparked wild speculation over his playing future after hinting at a return to Spain.

Ibrahimovic's time at LA Galaxy recently came to an end after they were beaten in the Western Conference semi-finals by city rivals Los Angeles FC.

The 38-year-old posted a video on his Instagram on Tuesday in which he revealed he would be returning to Spain, where he played for two years from 2009 to 2011.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic told his 39 million followers on Instagram of his plans after LA Galaxy

Ibrahimovic said he will return to Spain where he played for Barcelona between 2009 and 2011

In the video, he said: 'Hola Espana! Guess what? I’m coming back.'

It has sent his millions of followers into a frenzy with some of the belief the veteran striker could be making a return to La Liga.

More than likely, though, he could simply be returning to Europe to work with a number of his sponsors.

Ibrahimovic's time in MLS has been a success, with him scoring 52 goals in 56 matches

Ibrahimovic's time in the United States has been a success with him scoring 52 goals in 56 MLS matches.

On the prospect of playing in next season's MLS, he said: 'If I stay, I think for MLS it’s good, because the whole world will watch it.

'If I don’t stay, nobody will remember what MLS is.'
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic has sparked wild speculation over his playing future after hinting at a return to Spain. Ibrahimovic's deal with LA Galaxy in MLS recently expired.
